Hi Tim,

This is a interesting section and not much explored area of discussion.
Well,  if you can throw some more light how to test JMS messages
integrate with JUnit, it would interest me further. Can u direct to links
or resource helpful in designing test suites in this area.

Thanks.

Ranjeet Sahay


"Leeuw van der, Tim" wrote:

> This message is worth putting on display just for it's amazing
> content-to-sig ratio.
>
> Anyways, what do you want to test? There's many ways to test JMS related
> things, either with or without jUnit.
> If you abstract the JMS layer into a messaging-facade, you can replace the
> actual messaging-facade with a Mockup. The mockup directly connects the
> sender to the receiver and runs outside the app. server.
>
> Cut down and slice up as desired; you don't have to connect sender and
> receiver this way always - you can put a stub at either end to test them
> seperately.
>
> --Tim
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kadam, Sal [mailto:skadam@...]
> Sent: woensdag 1 oktober 2003 22:59
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: [junit] How to test JMS code with any App. Server
>
> Guys,
>   Any thoughts.
>
>
> Thanks
>  Sal
